benchmark_details.name: LongV ALE (Vision-Audio-Language Event Benchmark Towards Time-Aware Omni-Modal Perception of Long Videos)
benchmark_details.overview: LongV ALE is the first omni-modality long video benchmark, providing precise temporal boundaries and detailed relation-aware captions for 105K omni-modal events within 8.4K high-quality long videos. It aims to enhance cross-modal learning and fine-grained temporal understanding.
benchmark_details.data_type: omni-modal events with temporal boundaries and captions

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for fine-grained omni-modal video understanding.

data.source: Derived from the ACA V-100M dataset, filtered for high-quality video content.
data.annotation: Automated annotation pipeline for high-quality temporal boundaries and captions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the comparison of predicted event boundaries and captions against ground truth values.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in correctly identifying temporal boundaries and generating accurate captions.
methodology.validation: Manual checks and corrections for the test set to ensure accuracy in annotations.
